data.title: training – Buckinghamshire Culture
data.meta_description: Posts about training written by buckinghamshireculture
data.text:
Training and Development Opportunities for Bucks Cultural Organisations

July Events

Going Green Gathering – 1st July, 2pm Online

Amersham Museum and Buckinghamshire Culture led the first of four sessions exploring carbon neutrality and the journey to net zero on 20th May at Amersham Museum. This series of events has been designed to bring people together, to discuss their Going Green journey, and to ask questions and share ideas. Further sessions will take place on 1st July ’24 (online), November ’24 (online) and March ’25 (in person) and each will have a different focus.

Our Going Green Gathering on 1st July will take place online and will have a buildings focus. We have invited Rory Cullen of Cullen Conservation to speak and Mike King from Bucks Business Firsts’ Net Zero project.

Rory Cullen was Head of Buildings for the National Trust for 16 years. He is the co-author of the British Standard for the Conservation of Historic Buildings, until recently was Chair of the Chartered Institute of Building Heritage Panel, & currently sits on the Technical Panel of the Institute of Historic Buildings. He has a Masters in Historic Buildings & is heritage certified at expert level. Since 2017 he has had his own Heritage Consultancy practice, Cullen Conservation, which includes providing conservation-related training for Practitioners & home owners at all levels, both in the UK & Europe. Recent iconic projects include Marble Arch & Castle Howard amongst many others

Book a place here: https://forms.gle/UaUGeLUqh3r5wAdS8

Creative Exploration – Music, Nature, Create

Tuesday 9th July, 5pm-7pm

Primrose Health, Kiln Lane, Tring HP23 6LT

You are invited! How about enjoying a creative activity while you build relationships with peers working in the Bucks cultural sector?

Let’s explore how the boundaries of your environment and space can impact your creativity and enjoy the benefits of working in nature.

Whether performance or group work is your gig, this session is open to all creative practitioners and interested individuals.

We’ll be introducing the idea of nature as a co-facilitator, challenging the boundaries of your physical work space and offer insights for performing or running a workshop outside.

You don’t need any previous musical experience to attend or a perfect pitch! you’ll only need your voice as voice work and singing will be our primary tools. Bring suitable footwear and some layers to enjoy the great Bucks outdoors and if the weather has a wobble, we got you covered!

Book a place via this link: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdOoP3IVCCC9wSGcw2-C5yTWw4dCz3t0LZTwR9JmMdqTDEPlg/viewform?usp=sf_link

September and Beyond

Thinking About Heritage with NLHF

September 10th – 1-3:30pm

Online

The first session of a linked two-part session. National Lottery Heritage Fund (NLHF) present conversations on heritage inviting attendees to reflect on concepts and content eligible for funding support.

Please book via this link: https://forms.gle/nGSqSzjgjBPwgMu78

How To Apply with NLHF

September 24th – 1-3:30pm

Online

The second part of our linked two-part session is delivered to support partners across the cultural sector to apply for funding from the National Lottery Heritage Fund. How to navigate the application portal and other top tips.

Please book via this link: https://forms.gle/nGSqSzjgjBPwgMu78

Telling Great Stories

October 4th – 1-3pm

Queens Park Arts Centre

Co-produced with Unbound Theatre and reflecting on storytelling practice.

Join us at Queens Park Arts Centre for a fun and inclusive session as we explore the role of story-telling. Discover the fascinating story of one of Buckinghamshire’s home-grown storytelling companies as it celebrates 10 years of work in Buckinghamshire and beyond. A chance to hear from – and work with – Unbound’s team of experienced actors, writers, directors and producers to explore how to develop your practice and apply storytelling techniques to your work.

The session includes a keynote presentation from Unbound’s creative producer Dario Knight, a Q+A with the company’s storytellers, and culminates in a facilitated discussion, networking opportunity, and preparation for the Bucks Culture Conference.

Book via this link: https://forms.gle/EDzjR7Kaw7V3hfBW8

CPD, Policies, Procedures and Best Practice Focus

October 15th – 1:30-3.00pm

Online

Policies, procedures and best practice – everything you need to deliver great projects.

Best approaches to risk assessments, safeguarding and supporting vulnerable audiences. Work with us to learn how to write policies and procedures to best support creative programmes. We will cover:

Safeguarding – Grace Weller from Roald Dahl Museum and Story Centre will look at safeguarding for young people, volunteers and vulnerable groups

Safety First – supporting good practice for venue-based risk assessments, handling collections, supporting artists, and workshop styles.

Archives as Partner – Daniel Williams from Bucks Archives invites collaboration.

Production Insight – All you need to deliver great projects, followed by facilitated networking.
